goal.tools.unittest.testsection

Class EvaluateIn

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.unittest.testsection.EvaluateIn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestSection

    public class EvaluateIn
extends java.lang.Object
implements TestSection
    Evaluate-in statement. The evaluate-in statement evaluates a list of TestConditions while executing an action or module. The queries in the evaluate-in statement are evaluated by a TestConditionEvaluator. Each TestCondition provides an evaluator that can be used to evaluate that condition. When an test condition is evaluated, the corresponding evaluator is run as debugger. The evaluators are DebugObservers that listen to Channel.ACTION_EXECUTED_BUILTIN and Channel.ACTION_EXECUTED_USERSPEC. Evaluation of the test conditions happens in three phases.
    1. Install evaluators.
    2. Trigger TestConditionEvaluator.firstEvaluation().
    3. Execute the action associated with EvaluateIn using the installed Evaluators. Whenever an action is executed the test condition is evaluated.
    4. Trigger TestConditionEvaluator.lastEvaluation().
    5. Uninstall evaluators.
      Author:
      mpkorstanje
